body_html: @apaszke Is there any way that gradcheck passes for float operations. I am working on adversarial attacks and due to this precision loss in adversarial attacks over iterations I am getting different output across iterations. If I use DoubleTensors it works but becomes very slow (3-4 times slower)
body_text: @apaszke Is there any way that gradcheck passes for float operations. If I use DoubleTensors it works but becomes very slow (3-4 times slower)
body: @apaszke Is there any way that gradcheck passes for float operations. I am working on adversarial attacks and due to this precision loss in adversarial attacks over iterations I am getting different output across iterations. If I use DoubleTensors it works but becomes very slow (3-4 times slower)
